page.title: 13INTERESTING BUILDINGS
page.content: Most of the older part of{Ashton {Under Hill}is a conservation area. There are seventeen listed buildings including an 18th century Georgian house and others of great merit and interest. Outside the parish church, with it's Norman South Door and embattled tower,is a 14th century stone cross with a three step base, a shaft and sundial. Across the road is an ancient cowshed with a line of rare connecting stone drinking troughs. This building used to be in the grounds of Middle Farm, itself a listed building of rubble and tile, but it was sold together with an adjacent old barn. There are early black and white thatched cottages with delightful gardens, one of which used to be the Old Plough public house. Another listed building is the Manor House.
